channel.title: Patching a Gate - Delay/Looper/Echo
channel.description: I'd like to patch a trigger/gate delay/looper (echo) & not sure how to. It would be great if the object "delayedpulsedurationm" had a feedback control, so with sufficient feedback it would become a gate-looper. Controlling "delay" would change the loop-length. I have this idea from the hardware-box Flame Echometer I had some time ago. Putting Echo on Trigger/Gate signals can give repeated patterns (loops) & playing with delay-time spits out bursts & all kind of weird, mangled rhythms! One can experience this "effect" with some electribe boxes & volca beats: having echo on drums with a high feedback you can "re-sample" yourself twisting the time-knob & creating funky-fresh overdubbed poly-blabla rhythms. When one does this with gate signals, one is free to change the signal which gets triggered, by this echoed gate-mush. Let me know any ideas on this? Thanks!!
